instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no thunderbolt
threads.message:
completaly clean board, no power on the port that is close to the MagSafe and only sometimes I get power from the second port..
Don't have experience with this issue, need a kick start.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no thunderbolt
threads.message: For the love of God just don't even try. Looks like intermittent contact, so bad port is likely. Good luck replacing that, I NEVER fix Thunderbolt, nightmare.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no thunderbolt
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 12516"]For the love of God just don't even try. Looks like intermittent contact, so bad port is likely. Good luck replacing that, I NEVER fix Thunderbolt, nightmare.[/QUOTE]
